result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant GARY ALLEN HEDRINGTON in court.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for GARY ALLEN HEDRINGTON. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF410.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions. 
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia/ syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs/ any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license.

Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant GARY ALLEN HEDRINGTON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless appeared by video for GARY ALLEN HEDRINGTON.
